task_context.instructions: Analyze the game state and select the optimal move from 'allowed_actions'. You have 3 possible actions. If you wish to negotiate or wait for other players, select the 'wait_for_response' action.

recent_chat.message: Alright, time to lay down some road and start building my empire!
Alright, time to find a good spot to start my own expansion. Let's see what resources are available!
Alright, time to pave the way! My expansion will be towards the valuable resources I need.
Settling down with a strong base of Wheat and Ore! Looking forward to some good rolls and expanding my network.
Alright, my road is set! Paving the way towards some exciting new resource opportunities. Let's see what the dice bring next!
Alright, time for my second settlement! I'm securing a spot that gives me a good spread of resources to kickstart my growth.
Alright, my empire is taking shape! I'm laying down my final starting road, connecting to some valuable brick and wood hexes. Looking forward to some good rolls!

memory.note_from_last_turn: My second settlement is at Node 41, not 13 as my previous note stated. I have successfully established a diverse resource base with settlements at 13 (W, S) and 41 (O, Wh, B). I'm placing my second road from Node 13 to Node 14 to gain access to B2 and position myself for the B2 port at Node 7. My next focus should be accumulating resources to build more roads towards ports (W2 near 41, B2 near 13) or to secure additional settlement spots. Player B seems to be focusing on W,B,S,O and already has an O2 port. I should monitor their expansion.

constraints.usage_instructions: Choose one action type from the list below. Populate the 'parameters' field in your response strictly according to the 'example_parameters' structure provided.

allowed_actions.description: Do nothing on the board, just wait or communicate. Use this when you want to talk, negotiate, or think without taking a game action.

internal_thinking.description: Private strategy. What's your plan and why? Do not invent resources. Verify indices in Array N carefully. Write a detailed analysis (600+ chars) only AFTER verifying the node data

note_to_self.description: Save important observations and plans for future turns. Examples: opponent strategies, key nodes to claim, resource priorities, or threats to watch. This helps maintain continuity between turns.

say_outloud.description: Communicate with other players! Use for: trade proposals, warnings, bluffs, alliance hints, or strategic banter. Makes the game more interesting and can influence opponents.

type.description: The action type (must match one from allowed_actions in constraints)

parameters.description: Action parameters as JSON string. Example: {"node": 14} or {} if no parameters needed

allowed_actions.description: Do nothing on the board, just wait or communicate. Use this when you want to talk, negotiate, or think without taking a game action.
